page.title: 11KING JOHN'S HUNTING LODGE
page.content: {King John's Hunting Lodge}is a very old building. It is made of wood. On the ground floor the building stands on a stone sill, visible outside. This has prevented the wood from rotting and explains the survival of the house.On the second floor you go up winding stairs. You can see lath and plaster behind a little door in the wall.There was always a stone wall between the houses so fire could not spread.There is a model of the square on the top floor of the Lodge. Although Axbridge is an old place there are many new houses built in the last twenty years.On these new housing estates you will find a mixture of styles some are terraced some semi-detached and others detached.Some people own their houses whilst other people rent their houses from the local council.
